title: Do You Know Your Learning Style and How to Use...
text:
Share Your Experience, Advice, Suggestions, and Stories with Others Updated February 04, 2017 . 
How do you learn best? We've gathered our favorite learning styles inventories and articles to help you find out how you learn best. When you know how you learn best, you can make the most of the time you have in your busy life for learning something new. When you know how your students learn best, you can make learning easier for them. Compassionate Eye Foundation/Tom Grill - Getty Images Here's our list of resources for visual-spatial learners. More » 
continue reading below our video What are the Seven Wonders of the World Bambu Productions - Getty Images This is our collection of resources for understanding the auditory learning style. More » Arthur Tilley - The Image Bank - Getty Images AB20274 These resources are for students who learn in a tactile-kinesthetic way. More » New York Public Library by victoriapeckham / Flickr. by victoriapeckham / Flickr Once you know your learning style, you can maximize the time you have available for learning by choosing resources that match the way you work. Sensible. More » Javier Pierini - Getty Images 5. Learning Styles - The Controversy 
What is the controversy over learning styles all about? Is the theory valid? Does it really work in the classroom, or is the claim that there is no scientific evidence for its validity the final word? 
We're collecting articles that call the learning styles theory a myth. We'll keep adding to it as we find interesting discussions. Weigh in. What do you think about the learning styles theory? Truth or myth? At the end of the list there's a chance for you to share your opinion. We'd like to hear it. More » nullplus - E Plus - Getty Images 154967519 You have not one but at least seven intelligences that can enhance your capacity to learn. Do you know which of your multiple intelligences are strongest? Find out. More » Jupiterimages - Getty Images 7. Your Peak Learning Time What time of day are you at your best for learning something new? When you can schedule learning for your peak learning time, information soaks into your brain a little easier. Then you've got extra time for something else! Winning! More » Jack Hollingsworth - Getty Images Do you look for big ideas and overall concepts when learning something new? Or are you a by-the-book, one-thing-at-a-time, starting-from-the-very-beginning kind of person? Find out with this quiz. More » Stewart Cohen - Getty Images Based on Ned Herrmann's pioneering work, this inventory helps you identify whether you prefer facts or feelings, logic or imagination, and thinking things through yourself or with other people. More » Student asking question by Steve McAlister Productions-The Image Bank-Getty Images This new approach to learning by Marcia Heiman demands questioning, and we mean that in the most positive way. Heiman's new learning system is all about asking questions. Which questions are you asking? More » Prev
